betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Although you should be able to jar nodes using the advanced method soon at worst, there's no escaping the fact that some nodes are pale - or worse - when you find them. And getting better at node jarring does nothing to resolve issues like a node being Tainted anyhow.

Since you've learned not to ignore nodes you've created this device, able to manipulate the node's own energies to change it's nature. It's a slow process, though considering it would otherwise be a §odangerously unstable§r process you'll just grit your teeth.

Part of you wonders if it's worth the effort, considering that energized nodes aren't able to do things like spread Tainted Lands and those are what you're using these days. But then you imagine energizing a Tainted node, missing a single Tendril cleaning up afterwards, and by the time you realize half your base is purple. If you'll go the extra mile either way you'll do so addressing the problem at it's source.

§3None of this is relevant if you're sourcing endgame nodes through bees, BTW.
